# google_access_context_manager_supported_services

Lists all VPC Service Controls supported services.

## Example Usage

```tf
data "google_access_context_manager_supported_services" "all" {}
```

### Filter to GA services available on restricted VIP

```tf
data "google_access_context_manager_supported_services" "all" {}

locals {
  ga_restricted_services = [
    for s in data.google_access_context_manager_supported_services.all.supported_services :
    s.name if s.service_support_stage == "GA" && s.available_on_restricted_vip
  ]
}

output "ga_restricted_services" {
  value = local.ga_restricted_services
}
```

## Argument Reference

This data source has no required arguments.

## Attributes Reference

The following attributes are exported:

- `supported_services` - The list of VPC-SC supported services. Each service contains the following fields:

  - `name` - The service name or address of the supported service, such as `storage.googleapis.com`.

  - `title` - The name of the supported product, such as 'Cloud Storage'.

  - `support_stage` - The support stage of the service.

  - `available_on_restricted_vip` - True if the service is available on the restricted VIP. Services on the restricted VIP typically either support VPC Service Controls or are core infrastructure services required for the functioning of Google Cloud.

  - `known_limitations` - True if the service is supported with some limitations. Check [documentation](https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls/docs/supported-products) for details.

  - `service_support_stage` - The support stage of the service. Values are `GA`, `PREVIEW`, and `DEPRECATED`.
